DOC.brief_summary: This clinical trial tests the hypothesis that engineered human skin can reduce the requirements for harvesting of conventional skin autografts by providing more skin for grafting from the donor skin used to treat the wounds. In life-threatening burns (e.g., greater than 50% of the total body surface area), greater availability of skin may be definitive to patient survival, and may reduce scar formation at the donor site, and from use of widely-meshed skin autograft.
DOC.brief_title: Autologous Engineered Skin Substitutes for Closure of Skin Wounds
DOC.criteria: Burns greater than 50% of the total body surface area (TBSA), including 10% TBSA fullthickness injury Subject is not septic Skin grafting expected after 3 weeks following the skin biopsy Informed Consent signed. Subject is pregnant or lactating Subject is a prisoner Subject is mentally incompetent
